[JERRY] Wait, you can't make a call like that on your way out. You can't rush that conversation.

chosen.content:
[ELAINE] Oh, come on. I can make a quick call. It's like you have a minute or two of downtime, it'll be over.
[JERRY] Why don't you give her the number of the limo? She can call you when she's in here.
[ELAINE] But I want to talk to her in person - that's why I called.
[JERRY] She can't talk to you while she's in there?
[ELAINE] Yeah.
[KRAMER] You know, that story about Albert Einstein wasn't that good. Maybe it needs more pacing. It needs more movement.
[JERRY] More movement?
[KRAMER] You know, like a twisting twist at the end. Twisty twisty!
[GEORGE] What?
[KRAMER] You see how they did that "I wonder what happened to..."? It was so nice and simple, so subtle.
[JERRY] Kramer, we didn't just do it like that - we were putting together a whole story here - and it was all interconnected - with subplots and then--
[KRAMER] Well then you should have at least made it a little bit more complicated for me. That was very obvious.

rejected.content:
[ELAINE] No, I have to make this call.
[JERRY] Alright. Let me help you.
[ELAINE] But we're going downtown.
[JERRY] There is no way. It's not a problem. Let me go.
[KRAMER] Oh, but the place was moving!
[JERRY] So move!
[ELAINE] I can't just call and leave - they're going to be so upset if we're late for the meeting with Blavika.
[JERRY] Who is Blavika?
[ELAINE] She's a French producer.
[KRAMER] C'est moi! Oui oui - this is Blavika!
[JERRY] Look - why don't you tell them to meet you at the apartment?
[KRAMER] Hey, they're going to be mad at us for staying at your place - we were supposed to stay at ours!
[GEORGE] Uh, hi Blavika? How ya doin'? Ya know that Jerry and Elaine are runnin' behind? They'll probably be here any second now, or maybe even sooner. If they get here now, I'll be leaving in 20 seconds... Okay see ya...
